alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:35PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, DEARBORN, SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, BOONE, NORTHWESTERN OWEN, GALLATIN, WESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Rushville to 10 miles southwest of Greensburg to 9 miles south of Brownstown, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Florence, Forest Park, Erlanger, Monroe, Trenton, Springdale, Harrison, North College Hill, Wyoming, Cheviot, Villa Hills, Mount Healthy, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Ludlow, Carrollton and Aurora. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 77. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 170 and 183. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 2 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
